definitions: make someone feel awkward, self-conscious or ashamed in social situations
hinder or impede the action or progress of something
examples: His clumsy jokes embarrassed everyone at the dinner party
The teacher's praise embarrassed the shy student in class
Financial problems embarrassed the company's expansion plans significantly
The scandal embarrassed the government's diplomatic efforts abroad

definitions: fix an object firmly and deeply into a surrounding mass or substance
incorporate data or code within a document or computer program
examples: The archaeologist carefully embedded markers in the excavation site
Shrapnel was deeply embedded in the soldier's protective armor
The programmer embedded tracking code into the website's framework
The journalist embedded links within the article for reference

definitions: make something more attractive by adding decorative details or features
add fictitious or exaggerated details to make a story more interesting
examples: The artist embellished the manuscript with intricate golden patterns
She embellished her plain dress with colorful embroidered flowers
He tends to embellish his travel stories with dramatic adventures
The witness embellished the truth during the courtroom testimony

definitions: give tangible or visible form to an abstract idea or quality
include or contain something as a constituent part comprehensively
examples: The statue embodies the spirit of freedom and independence
Her performance perfectly embodies the character's inner turmoil
The new constitution embodies principles of democratic governance
This design embodies all the features customers requested

definitions: hold someone closely in one's arms expressing affection or greeting
accept or support a belief, theory or change willingly and enthusiastically
examples: The mother warmly embraced her daughter after months apart
Old friends embraced each other at the reunion celebration
The company embraced new technology to improve productivity significantly
She embraced the challenge of learning a foreign language

definitions: act as master of ceremonies at an entertainment or public event
examples: She will emcee the charity gala next Saturday evening
The comedian emceed the awards ceremony with great enthusiasm

definitions: move out or away from something and become visible
become apparent or known after being concealed or uncertain
gradually develop or come into existence over a period
examples: The submarine slowly emerged from beneath the ocean surface
Butterflies emerge from their chrysalises in early spring
New evidence emerged during the investigation last week unexpectedly
The truth finally emerged after years of careful research
A new leader emerged from the political crisis discussions
Digital currencies emerged as alternatives to traditional banking systems

definitions: leave one's own country to settle permanently in another country
examples: His grandparents emigrated from Ireland during the potato famine
Many skilled workers emigrate to find better job opportunities

definitions: produce and discharge something such as gas, radiation, light or sound
examples: The factory emits harmful chemicals into the atmosphere daily
Stars emit light that travels millions of years through space

definitions: understand and share the feelings of another person through emotional connection
examples: Good counselors empathize with their clients' emotional struggles deeply
She could empathize with his loss having experienced similar grief

definitions: give special importance or prominence to something when speaking or writing
examples: The professor emphasised the key points before the examination
The report emphasises the need for immediate environmental action

definitions: give special importance or prominence to something when speaking or writing
examples: The manager emphasized the deadline during the team meeting
Politicians emphasize different issues during their campaign speeches regularly

definitions: hire someone to do work in exchange for regular payment
make use of a particular method, technique or resource purposefully
examples: The company employs over five thousand workers across multiple locations
Small businesses employ local residents to support community growth
Scientists employ various methods to test their hypotheses rigorously
The artist employs bold colors to create dramatic visual effects

definitions: give someone official authority or legal power to do something
make someone stronger and more confident in controlling their life
examples: The constitution empowers citizens to vote for their representatives
The board empowered the CEO to make strategic decisions
Education empowers individuals to escape poverty and pursue opportunities
The workshop empowers women to start their own businesses

definitions: remove all contents from a container or space completely
become vacant or unoccupied as people or things leave
examples: Please empty the dishwasher when the cycle finishes running
Workers empty the garbage bins every Tuesday morning regularly
The stadium empties quickly after the final whistle blows
The parking lot empties when the shopping mall closes

definitions: match or surpass achievement by imitating someone or something admiringly
examples: Young athletes emulate their sports heroes' training methods carefully
The software emulates older operating systems for compatibility testing

definitions: make it possible for someone to do something or something to happen
turn on or activate a function or feature in a system
examples: Technology enables people to work from anywhere in the world
The scholarship enabled her to attend the prestigious university
Please enable cookies in your browser for better functionality
The administrator enabled two-factor authentication for security purposes

definitions: make a bill or proposal into law through official legislative process
act out a role or play on stage or in real life
examples: Congress enacted new environmental protection laws last year successfully
The government enacted emergency measures during the health crisis
Students enacted scenes from Shakespeare during the drama festival
The children enacted their favorite fairy tale for parents

definitions: apply a smooth hard coating to metal, glass or pottery surfaces
examples: The artist carefully enameled the copper jewelry with vibrant colors
Craftsmen enamel decorative plates using traditional firing techniques expertly

definitions: enclose something in or as if in a capsule completely
express the essential features of something succinctly and clearly
examples: Scientists encapsulate medicine in gel capsules for controlled release
The material encapsulates toxic waste preventing environmental contamination
Her speech perfectly encapsulated the spirit of the movement
This paragraph encapsulates the main argument of the thesis

definitions: form a circle around something or someone completely on all sides
examples: Police officers encircled the building to prevent anyone escaping
Mountains encircle the valley creating a natural protective barrier

definitions: surround or close off something on all sides creating a boundary
place something inside an envelope or package with a letter
examples: High walls enclose the private garden from public view completely
The fence encloses three acres of agricultural land securely
Please enclose your payment with the completed application form
I enclose my resume for your consideration and review

definitions: convert information into a coded form for transmission or storage
convert genetic or sensory information into a biological storage format
examples: Programmers encode data before transmitting it over networks securely
The software encodes video files into compressed formats efficiently
DNA encodes genetic instructions for organism development and function
The brain encodes memories through complex neural pathway patterns

definitions: include a wide range or variety of things within a scope
examples: The course encompasses all aspects of modern business management
Her research encompasses several disciplines including psychology and sociology

definitions: perform an additional piece of music or entertainment after finishing
examples: The enthusiastic audience demanded the band encore their hit song
The pianist encored with a beautiful Chopin nocturne performance

definitions: meet someone or something unexpectedly or experience for first time
be faced with or have to deal with a difficult situation
examples: We encountered several deer while hiking through the forest
She encountered her old professor at the conference yesterday
The project encountered unexpected technical difficulties during development
Travelers may encounter delays due to severe weather conditions

definitions: give someone support, confidence or hope through words or actions
help or stimulate an activity, state or view to develop
examples: Teachers encourage students to ask questions during class discussions
Her parents encouraged her to pursue her artistic dreams
The government encourages small business growth through tax incentives
Warm weather encourages plant growth in the garden naturally

definitions: gradually intrude on someone's territory, rights or personal space illegally
examples: Urban development encroaches on wildlife habitats every year increasingly
The neighbor's fence encroaches on our property by two feet

definitions: convert information into code to prevent unauthorized access using algorithms
examples: Banks encrypt customer data to protect against identity theft
The messaging app encrypts conversations using end-to-end security protocols

definitions: bring something to a conclusion or cause something to stop
come to a termination point or cease to exist completely
examples: The meeting ended earlier than expected due to agreements
She decided to end the relationship after careful consideration
The road ends at the beach parking lot entrance
All good things must end eventually according to wisdom

definitions: put someone or something at risk of harm, damage or destruction
examples: Pollution endangers marine life in oceans around the world
Reckless driving endangers the lives of innocent pedestrians daily

definitions: try hard to do or achieve something through sustained effort
examples: Scientists endeavor to find cures for devastating diseases worldwide
The team will endeavor to complete the project on schedule

definitions: try hard to do or achieve something through sustained effort
examples: We endeavour to provide excellent customer service consistently always
The organization endeavours to promote peace through diplomatic dialogue

definitions: declare public approval or support for someone or something officially
sign a check on the back to authorize payment or transfer
examples: The celebrity endorsed the new product during the commercial
Several newspapers endorsed the candidate before the election publicly
Please endorse the check before depositing it at the bank
She endorsed the traveler's check to cash it abroad

definitions: provide a permanent fund or source of income to an institution
provide someone with a quality, ability or asset naturally or formally
examples: The alumnus endowed a scholarship fund for deserving students
Wealthy patrons endow museums with valuable art collections regularly
Nature endowed her with exceptional musical talent from birth
The constitution endows citizens with fundamental rights and freedoms

definitions: suffer something painful or difficult patiently for a long time
remain in existence or continue without significant change over time
examples: Patients endure chronic pain while waiting for treatment options
The refugees endured terrible hardships during their dangerous journey
Classical literature endures because it addresses universal human themes
Their friendship endured despite years of separation and distance

definitions: give vitality and enthusiasm to a person or group dynamically
supply energy or power to a system or device electrically
examples: The motivational speaker energized the audience with inspiring stories
Morning coffee energizes millions of workers before starting work
Solar panels energize the building during daylight hours efficiently
The battery energizes the circuit when properly connected correctly

definitions: compel observance of or compliance with a law, rule or obligation
examples: Police officers enforce traffic laws to ensure road safety
The school strictly enforces its dress code policy consistently

definitions: participate or become involved in an activity or conversation actively
attract and hold someone's attention or interest completely and actively
arrange to employ or hire someone for their professional services
examples: Students actively engage in classroom discussions about current events
The company engages with customers through social media platforms
The novel's plot engages readers from the very first page
Interactive exhibits engage children at the science museum effectively
They engaged a lawyer to handle the complex legal matter
We engaged a consultant to improve our business processes

definitions: cause or give rise to a feeling, situation or condition
examples: His controversial speech engendered heated debate among the listeners
Trust engenders loyalty in both personal and professional relationships

definitions: design and build machines, structures or systems using scientific principles
skillfully or artfully arrange for something to occur through planning
examples: The team engineered a revolutionary new electric vehicle design
Scientists engineered drought-resistant crops using genetic modification techniques
Politicians engineered the merger between the two major parties
She cleverly engineered a meeting with the company's CEO

definitions: cut or carve text or design on a hard surface permanently
examples: The jeweler engraved their initials on the wedding rings
Artists engrave intricate patterns on metal plates for printing

definitions: completely surround, swallow up or overwhelm something powerfully and suddenly
examples: Flames quickly engulfed the wooden building despite firefighting efforts
Darkness engulfed the city when the power grid failed

definitions: intensify, increase or further improve the quality, value or extent
examples: The new software enhances photo quality with artificial intelligence
Regular exercise enhances both physical and mental health significantly

definitions: take delight or pleasure in an activity or occasion happily
possess and benefit from something good or advantageous consistently
examples: Children enjoy playing in the park on sunny afternoons
She really enjoyed the concert despite the crowded venue
The city enjoys a Mediterranean climate throughout the year
He enjoys excellent health despite his advanced age remarkably

definitions: make or become bigger in size, scale or extent physically
speak or write about something in greater detail or depth
examples: The photographer enlarged the image to poster size perfectly
The company plans to enlarge its warehouse facilities significantly
The professor enlarged upon her theory during the lecture
Could you enlarge on that point in your presentation?

definitions: give someone greater knowledge and understanding about a subject or situation
examples: The documentary enlightened viewers about climate change causes comprehensively
Please enlighten me about your decision-making process here today

definitions: enroll voluntarily for military service in armed forces officially
engage someone's help or support in a venture or cause
examples: Young men enlisted in the army during the war
She enlisted in the navy straight after high school
The charity enlisted celebrities to promote their fundraising campaign
We need to enlist expert help for this project

definitions: ask for information from someone about something politely or formally
examples: Customers often enquire about product availability and pricing details
She enquired whether the position was still available yesterday

definitions: improve or enhance the quality or value of something substantially
make someone wealthy or wealthier through financial gain or profit
examples: Reading widely enriches your vocabulary and understanding significantly always
Travel experiences enrich our lives in countless meaningful ways
The oil discovery enriched the small nation almost overnight dramatically
Corrupt officials enriched themselves at the public's expense illegally
